Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art beside me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me...

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Marcus-- I'm Doctor Serena Kogan, I'm with Project Angel. You consented to donate your body to science...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm pretty much done with it.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: You've been chosen for our research.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: We just need a couple of signatures...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: You don't need to be scared.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: You're not the only one with a death sentence.

Speaker: team leader
Dialogue: You will not believe the shit we found down here--

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: --repeat, that was not us! A ship escaped, they musta blown the place themselves! Jesus, a lot of our guys were still down there...

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Hey mister, where you goin' in such a hurry?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: You're human... you can see me, you can touch me. This place is real.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Those things with masks, red eyes--

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Terminators-- T-400s.   What is this stuff?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: If I'm not in hell, where am I?!

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Do it, Star. Put it down.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: There was only one bullet in that gun.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I don't like it when people point guns at me.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: You took on a guy like me with one bullet and an empty shotgun?  Pretty stupid.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Can I have my gun back?

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: The city? Oh man. That place is red hot.

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: It's an H-K-- hunter-killer.   Where the hell have you been?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Rads musta fried his brains.   Let's go, Kyle.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Kyle Reese.  --so I call her Star.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Fifteen years... I've lost 15 years. So who did it to us? Terrorists? The Russians, the Chinese--?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: The nukes. There was a war, right? Who started it?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Something fall on your head? The machines did it, the computers-- they got smart.

Speaker: star
Dialogue: Judgment Day... I was just a baby.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: What's the last thing you remember?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: That flying grapefruit, what was it?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Aerostat-- one of Skynet's eyes. They patrol places like this, looking for survivors.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: So can I.  Well, sort of... a little.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Never heard anyone say that before.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Oh yeah. Was about all I ever had to look forward to in the joint.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Prison. Spent half my life there.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: I remember TV a little.   Cartoons. It was great.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Dunno. Been together since we was little. Bunch of us kids was at the day-care center when the bombs fell... she and me are the only ones still around.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: So this is it? Your life?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: We're gonna find the Resistance, fight for John Connor against Skynet. You oughta join us, you're pretty cool.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: You're strong, you can read... you didn't kill us. Good enough for me...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Skynet runs the machines...?   So who's this John Connor?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: He's... I don't know. The best. Everybody talks about him. He's the one who's gonna save us.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: So why were you in prison?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Well... Nah, some of `em were all right.
CONTINUED:  Max must be dead too, now... like everybody else.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: You gonna be here when I wake up?

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Good.   Stay away from the windows.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: The bible. My grandma always tried to get me into it, but-- it always put me to sleep.  Still does.

Speaker: star
Dialogue: Would you read something to me?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: "...of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori. Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son Jephunneh--"

Speaker: star
Dialogue: There's a book inside with pictures.

Speaker: star
Dialogue: So... all those numbers... you could call them and get, like, flowers, or someone to come over and fix stuff, or bring you food...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: What else we got... movers, mufflers, music--

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Come on. You must...  "We are family... I got all my sisters with me..." No, huh. How about... "Twinkle twinkle little star..."

Speaker: star
Dialogue: Somebody used to sing that to me.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: If we get it to move, will you teach me to make it go?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Not too many around in my time.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Pop the clutch! Let your foot up!

Speaker: star
Dialogue: Oh no! It's gonna call a Harvester, we're dead--

Speaker: radio voice
Dialogue: --proper ratio of ammonium nitrate to diesel fuel. A bomb of this type can be contained in an ordinary plastic garbage bag, and will detonate on impact...

Speaker: radio voice
Dialogue: This recording has described booby- traps and explosive devices. It will repeat every two hours on different frequencies to avoid Skynet jamming...

Speaker: radio voice
Dialogue: Do not give in to despair. As bleak as things seem, I assure you, humanity will triumph.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: We oughta find a place to hole up for the day...

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: We didn't kill `em! I swear to God, they was dead already, we wasn't gonna let `em rot--

Speaker: bull
Dialogue: Go `head, take as much as you want, we're on the same side here--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: You can put me down now, Marcus.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: The hot zone? No you're not.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I've got to get to my friends--

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Couple of kids. They were in that flying dumpster--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: The Skynet transport? It was carrying people?  Christ, we almost shot it down. There've been rumors about a concentration camp, but...

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: They can't see, but they have killer sonar. They'll attack anything that moves or makes a sound. Even if you get past them, you'd be dead before you covered a hundred yards. If the terminators don't get you, the fallout will-- heavy rads all the way to the Gulf coast, nothing can live there.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Lt. Blair Williams, I fly for what used to be the Air National Guard.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I don't know... this has gotta be some kind of, like, dream or hallucination. Like what happens to people right before they die...

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: That snap you out of it?

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: So let me get this straight, Marcus. There you are on death row, they stick a needle in your arm...
CONTINUED: BLAIR  Since this ain't the resurrection, there's only one possibility.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Whatever they pumped into your veins just knocked you out. This Angel Project you signed up for-- there was a lotta cryogenic stuff going on before the bombs fell, they musta froze your ass.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Drug tests, medical experiments, organ harvesting, who knows? You said you had no family, no friends-- why let a body like yours go to waste?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I've never seen trees like these.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: We're in a mutation zone. I saw a two-headed squirrel here once--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: They're smart. And they don't scare easy.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: It's a resistance term.    Sit tight and fuck.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I'm not gay. In prison, I thought about puss-- women all the time. But now... it's not working. Who knows, all those years on ice...

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Maybe it's just gonna take some time. Before you're completely thawed out.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I dunno. They just... sorta reminded me of her.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: There's a woman, the last woman I saw before... when I was under, the dead time-- she kept coming to me. I think she must've saved me.

Speaker: star
Dialogue: What's going to happen to us?

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Christ... there's supposed to be barbed wire along the edge.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Whatever you do, don't move.  We're in the middle of the mine field.

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: Blair? Good to see you.  What's the password?

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Could you get us outta here please?

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: Kinda dumb-ass, wandering around in a mine field.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: You didn't maintain the perimeter! Where are your sentries?

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: It's too early for that military crap.

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: Son of a bitch is heavy.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: He stepped on a Claymore? This guy oughta be in a hundred pieces...

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Does he have a prosthetic limb?

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: This is not skin... oh Jesus-- oh God--

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Why isn't he conscious? Something's wrong, he should be coming out of it by now...

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Thermoplastic skin, some larger hydraulics, but mostly titanium microgears... This looks like some sort of aeration and hydration system, function unclear at this point. Valves and what looks like an access panel below the ribcage...

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Whatever he is-- he's on our side--

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: Winning your trust would aid his infiltration.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Regional doesn't know what to do. They're gonna patch us through to Command Los Angeles.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: How could you bring this monster here?! This is our home! Our children--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: What do you want from me-- I didn't know!

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Get me the hell down from here!

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: Shut up!   I told you to shut up!

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Leave him alone!  Marcus, I'm so sorry...

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: It keeps talkin' at me. God this thing gives me the creeps.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Why are you doing this?    What is this place?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Don't say anything!     It's probably uplinked to Skynet.

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: Then it's already too late.  This used to be an ICBM silo, we're just trying to stay alive here. Your turn-- where'd you come from?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Corpus Christi. It's in Texas.     Or it was.

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: It sounds completely human... it really could pass.

Speaker: jane
Dialogue: Didn't John Connor say they'd start building things like this?

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: Not yet-- not for years.  So, you're programmed with false memories, a human history--

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: You can skip the act, we know what you are.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Why are you even speaking to it?!

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: She's right, let's just waste the damn thing--

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: It'll kill us all if we give it a CHANCE--

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Regional got through to CLA-- they want us to rig a video feed.  He wants to see him.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: So this guy is what, like king of the world, or what's left of it?

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: John Connor founded the Resistance. When the war began, no one even knew who the enemy was-- Connor taught us how to fight back. He saved humanity.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Yeah, well, humanity's never done all that much for me. Why can't I see him?

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: Nobody sees him. Skynet can't be allowed to discover his location, even his appearance is kept secret.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Sir, we can hear you, sir, working on a visual, sir...

Speaker: connor's voice
Dialogue: It does seem lifelike-- is the face able to mimic emotions--?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: This shit is ridiculous. What the hell do you want from me?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: I-- I need to know what you are.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: So do I! I don't know what I am, what I'm doing here, I don't know shit-- maybe I never did, but-- I'm sick of it! Just blow my head off or let me go.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: This isn't right. I can't be having a conversation with a terminator, Skynet isn't that sophisticated yet. Unless... were you sent here from the future?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Skynet's developing a time displacement field, we've decrypted recent data transmissions.  I know for a fact that soon machines will be travelling back decades. To try and stop us from winning this war before it begins...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: You're out of your mind, aren't you?

Speaker: connor's voice
Dialogue: Jesus... I've seen enough. Stand by for further instructions.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: He's not a cyborg-- no blood, no human tissue over the endoskeleton.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Besides, the first T-800s won't be

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Get him to our best people for disassembly, find out what makes him tick. We need to get into that metal skull, crack his CPU at all costs.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Because people trust you... you give them faith--

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: No. Because I knew I would be, I was told. I know when and where the major battles are going to take place. I know I'm going to send my own father back through time to save my mother-- even though I haven't met him yet. Christ, I even know the year I'm going to die...

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: So how could I not know about this?!

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Feels like I been here before... what are you gonna do to me?

Speaker: morrison
Dialogue: Nothing. Los Angeles is sending a chopper-- seems you're some kind of VIP.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: How's it going, Barnes? Thought you might like a late-night snack.

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: Where in hell'd you get these?

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: We got a stash back at the base.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: You need something to wash it down.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: You know I always liked you, Barnes.   I just didn't want to join the harem.

Speaker: barnes
Dialogue: What can I say? It's our duty to repopulate the planet.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Noble of you to make the sacrifice.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: I don't believe you're a terminator.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Whatever you are-- I owe you one. Once you're free, I'll lie down next to Barnes-- they'll assume you escaped while we were passed out--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Worth a shot.  Marcus, Command wants to take you apart, cut open your head. One thing I know, you're alive-- and you've got a right to live.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: No human being can survive there--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: You're gonna try and save those kids.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: It's the only thing I can think of that makes any sense...

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Marcus, for all you know, they're dead already--

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: For all I know, they're the reason I'm back from the dead.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Should lead out, but there's no way past the fan--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Here. My ELT-- emergency locator transmitter. If you find the camp, activate it like this. It could really help the Resistance.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: I need to talk to the prisoner.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Lieutenant Williams. I'm sorry about the way you've been treated, but we're forced to take every precaution. I'm John Connor.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Sir-- he isn't a terminator.     He's human.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: We know he's crossed into Skynet territory, why would he do that if he isn't--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: He's trying to find his friends.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: A couple of kids. They were taken in a Skynet transport, probably to some kind of prison camp-- he said their names were Star and Kyle.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: I always knew I'd have to find him someday. I just didn't know how.

Speaker: star
Dialogue: Up above the world so high, like a diamond in the sky...

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Stop it stop it STOP IT!

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: You look like you've been hit by a truck--

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Among other things. Look, I'm trying to find some friends-- a couple of kids. They were taken here, I saw some buildings--

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: The facility, sure.   Hop in, I'll take you there.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: I can't connect with you at all... your interface must've been damaged. Don't worry, soon they'll have you as good as new.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I didn't think there was-- anything like this left... anywhere.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Yes.   We're very lucky.   Want some?

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Well, of course not. Seems you got a little memory loss going on.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: We don't call them that here.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: A hybrid.    The same as you.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Of course. That's what this community is for-- people like us.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: You should be grateful to have been chosen.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: What about the ones who weren't?

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: You mean like Janet and the kids.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: `Cause I feel good. The interface recognizes negative emotions-- rage, grief, despair-- and stimulates positive endorphins in response. Thank God, life would be pretty unbearable otherwise, don't you think?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Tell me everything.   How did you people get here?

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Most of us worked at NASA or DARPA. I was an engineer on Project Angel--

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: Advanced Nexus of Genetic and Electronic Life-forms... A-N-G-E-L. You can stop choking me, it's not like I need to breathe.

Speaker: jeremy
Dialogue: The goal was a superior support system for the human brain-- to go anywhere, do anything-- explore deep space, the bottom of the sea. I specialized in optics.

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: 32578 - acceptable. 32579 - no, insufficient neural capacity. 32580 - eh, this one shouldn't have even been brought here...

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: There was no choice-- the old civilization had to be eliminated. To make way for a new world... a world without death or suffering.

Speaker: aide
Dialogue: Sir, I'm sorry to disturb you, but you said you wanted to know immediately--

Speaker: naval officer
Dialogue: There can't be any prisoners there. The whole area's a nuclear wasteland-- only machines can survive the radiation levels for any length of time.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Mobilize a combined air and naval assault, all available resources. We're sending in a rescue team ASAP.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: All to find one teenage boy...? John, you really think this can work?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: I'm standing here, I exist-- so it must have worked. We will find him.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Calm down, Marcus.   It's all right.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Like fuck it is. I'm sick of being your guinea pig, what are you doing to me now?!

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Please. Skynet works for us. It's only a program-- a tool, a means to an end.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Its sole purpose is to protect humanity.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Into-- this? A brain in a box?

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Skynet had access to the entire defense web-- including Project Angel. It determined hybrids were the only path to salvation.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Destroying the human race in order to save it.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: When the resistance attacked our installation, we were forced to self-destruct. We would have taken you with us, but we thought you were in a permanent coma...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: No, stop... I don't want it! You're dead inside, all of you!

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: We're immortal. No sane person would choose to live in pain, forever. Soon you'll understand.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I'm not sure I know how to describe it.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: It's called happiness. You've been angry all your life. You don't know what it's like to feel... a part of something.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Pure ecstasy... we can share in it together.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: When I was a kid my grandmother would go on about heaven... it always sounded so boring.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Nanotechnology, polymimetic metals... working with Skynet, we're making amazing breakthroughs, well beyond anything possible before Judgment Day.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: We've already freed ourselves from biological limits... soon we'll transcend the laws of physics.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: A time machine... Connor was right.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: The Resistance leader?   You know him?

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: He's a dangerous man. Delusional. He thinks he's a savior, but all he's really fighting for is... death.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: In the world outside-- the survivors think Skynet is the enemy, out to destroy them. Why don't you tell them about all this?

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Not everyone can become like us, Marcus. We just don't have the resources to sustain more than a few thousand hybrids.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Then why... Some people I knew were picked up, taken here...

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: A boy and a girl-- in the last day or two?

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Part of the neural net-- human minds linked directly with artificial intelligence. The processing power of the human brain is still beyond anything Skynet can manufacture.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: Good news. He'll soon be part of the network-- you'll be able to connect with him.

Speaker: serena
Dialogue: I don't know-- I have to go.    Will you be all right?  Of course you will.

Speaker: physicist
Dialogue: The wormholing fluctuates, right now it's oscillating between three and six hours--

Speaker: physicist
Dialogue: Just breach the sphere. But you could materialize anywhere in a mile radius--

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: 32581 looks good... 32582... hm, borderline. May not be emotionally compatible. Pass.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: We've gotta get out of here.

Speaker: kyle
Dialogue: Come on I was doing good!

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: There are more prisoners, a complex about a mile in--

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: John Connor. I'm glad you made it.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I don't feel a thing.    Help somebody else.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Your dad-- he seems like a nice kid.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: The last boatload is right behind me. Skynet's pouring in reinforcements, we can't hold this place. And the people in the houses, they won't leave--

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Marcus... I need to head back to my unit.

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I have no idea. I should be dead...

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: We've been ordered not to talk about it-- the hybrids, everything about that place is top secret...

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Yeah, simpler to keep it man versus machine.

Speaker: star
Dialogue: What did it feel like?   To be... one of them?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: Better than anything. Everything made sense. For the first time in my life, I felt... right. It was heaven.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: How could you give that up?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: I never really believed in heaven.

Speaker: blair
Dialogue: Here.   You need these more than I do.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Her name was Sarah... she was... amazing...

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Kyle, could you give us a minute?

Speaker: marcus
Dialogue: You're asking me to become...  Him?

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Very few people know what John actually looks like. Only the technicians and our closest advisors need ever know the truth.

Speaker: kate
Dialogue: Who else? Only you know the enemy from the inside. You liberated a Skynet camp... you're a hero.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: I never knew how I was supposed to win this war. But I finally understand: the idea of John Connor is more important than the person.  I can die. He cannot.
